intro: Ophiorrhiza membranacea, commonly known as the membranous mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that belongs to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is often found growing on the branches of host trees such as mangroves and other tropical hardwoods. The plant has small, simple leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Ophiorrhiza membranacea plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat, contributing to nutrient cycling and providing food for various insect species.
